revised_title: Exploring the Structure and Function of Protein Modules in Enzymic Catalysis
tldr: The article discusses the structure and function of protein modules in enzymic catalysis. It highlights the use of protein expression techniques, nuclear magnetic resonance, and site-directed mutagenesis to study protein modules. The structures of growth factor, fibronectin type 1, and complement modules are described, and their functional roles in various proteins, including factor IX and tissue plasminogen activator, are discussed.
